ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Basic sentence structure. Foundational grammar rules, extensive vocabulary, reading comprehension, speaking
learning yoruba- especially how to be conversational
I built a very strong foundation in the Yoruba language particularly in terms of vocabulary and speaking.
a good introductory course to the language
I developed my speaking and writing skills in Yoruba.
I learned how to adapt to new cultures that were unique
I learned the Yoruba language.
I developed the ability to communicate in Yoruba on a basic level and I learned a lot of vocab in the language. I also learned a bit more about the culture through clothing and family discussions.
I learned basic words and phrases in a native language

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Seye is amazing
Weaknesses: none. I love this class

strengths- ojogbon (our professor) is funny and pretty wonderful. he kind of acts like a father figure which is just so nice. small weakness- the course materials could be a bit more organized or it would be nice to have modules on canvas that different the different sections of the material we are learning and for the files to be under their respective module

I think Professor Adesola did an amazing job in making the class fun and engaging. The delivery of the content was absolutely stellar and he would consistently check in for our feedback and ask how the class could be improved. I think there was just the right amount and difficulty of assignments to facilitate learning and Professor Adesola created a very very welcoming learning environment where everyone knew they could contribute and make mistakes without fear of embarrassment.
 
Perhaps the only weakness of the class was that it would be possible to fly under the radar and not contribute but even then Professor Adesola always made sure to involve everyone so no one could really stay silent for too long.

My favorite class this semester! I cant wait for L2!

Strengths: the professor and the fact that we can skip some questions on the quizzes

Weaknesses: the organization of the canvas
The strength of the course is definitely the classroom environment. It could be improved by using less class time to have students each go ahead and speak one at a time.
Professor Oluseye was very very patient when teaching us the language. He didn't have very many weaknesses other than decent communication such as things that would be on the test
The strengths of the course were the opportunities to better understand and help that I got from peers. The weaknesses of the class were the lack of explanation on assignments.
I think the strengths of this course lie in in-class skits and discussions. I think that it could be improved by increasing the number of listening exercises done inside and outside of class.
Sometimes its hard to understand when the instructor is speaking the language fast

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. Its a once in a lifetime opportunity to learn a west African language with the best professor at Yale.
absolutely 10000%
I truly would! Of course, as with any language if you dont use it youll forget it but for anyone even slightly interested in learning Yoruba theyd be hard pressed to find a better option.
yes!
Yes because it's pretty engaging and the work load isn't bad.
Yes because it broadens their horizons and it is a very fun course
Yes, this language was fun to learn.
Yes, I would recommend this course if a student wanted to learn Yoruba on a basic leve.
Yes you learn about another culture
Yes!
